description: Enterprise techniques used by Carbanak, ATT&CK group G0008 v1.0
name: Carbanak (G0008)

techniques.comment: Carbanak may use netsh to add local firewall rule exceptions.[4]
Carbanak malware names itself "svchost.exe," which is the name of the Windows shared service host program.[1]
Carbanak malware installs itself as a service to provide persistence and SYSTEM privileges.[1]
Carbanak used legitimate programs such as AmmyAdmin and Team Viewer for remote interactive C2 to target systems.[4]
Carbanak installs VNC server software that executes through rundll32.[1]
Carbanak actors used legitimate credentials of banking employees to perform operations that sent them millions of dollars.[1]
Carbanak has used a VBScript named "ggldr" that uses Google Apps Script, Sheets, and Forms services for C2.[3]
